Arlington_Heights.B'Ginnings:
B'Ginnings was a nightclub located in Schaumburg, Illinois, which opened in 1974. The principal and most well-known owner was Danny Seraphine, the drummer for the rock band Chicago, who had a hit song called "Beginnings." The club was noteworthy for bringing numerous "rising artists" to the Chicago area, particularly in the punk and new wave rock genres, but also booked many established artists, especially in jazz fusion.


== Closure ==
In 1980 Poplar Creek Music Theater opened just down the road.
